alert.note: Alert for Pine (Minnesota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Duluth (Northeast Minnesota and Northern Wisconsin)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued April 13 at 9:12PM CDT until April 18 at 7:00AM CDT by NWS Duluth
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota... Snake River near Pine City affecting Pine County. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE SATURDAY NIGHT TO TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. This approaches the flood of record. * WHERE...Snake River near Pine City. * WHEN...From late Saturday night to Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, This will cause flooding near Cross Lake near Pine City. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.3 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Sunday morning to a crest of 9.2 feet early Sunday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Tuesday morning. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.2 feet on 04/27/2001. - Flood safety information can be found at www.weather.gov/safety/flood. &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/duluth. The next statement will be issued Friday afternoon by 100 PM CDT.
